channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Can humor from Gwyneth save the Coldplay kiss cam company?
item.description: In an effort to change the conversation following its CEO getting caught at a Coldplay concert with the head of HR, Astronomer hired actress Gwyneth Paltrow to make an ad. Was it a successful PR move?

item.title: The American oystercatcher is rebounding as other shorebird populations decline
item.description: Studies show the populations of most North American shorebirds are declining. But the American oystercatcher found along the Atlantic and Gulf coasts is a success story.

item.title: Trump acknowledges 'real starvation' in Gaza, urging Israel to let food in
item.description: As hunger grips Gaza,President Trump acknowledges "real starvation" and calls on Israel to allow "every ounce of food" in.

item.title: Addiction community responds to Trump homelessness order
item.description: President Trump's executive order on homelessness aims to make it easier for states and cities to get people into mental health or addiction treatment, even if that means involuntary civil commitment.

item.title: How a woman in the registrar's office made a music teacher feel less alone
item.description: In 2009, Kim Perlak was teaching music at three different colleges while also working a number of other jobs. She felt totally alone. A woman in the registrar's office changed that.

item.title: A personal tale of an Iraqi friendship that has defied religion and conflict
item.description: NPR's Hadeel Al-Shalchi tells an unexpected family story from Israel about the friendship of her father and his Iraqi Jewish college friend.

item.title: This 'Fantastic Four' is retro-futurist fun
item.description: Marvel superheroes Mr. Fantastic (Pedro Pascal), Invisible Woman (Vanessa Kirby), Human Torch (Joseph Quinn) and Thing (Ebon Moss-Bachrach) take on planet-devourer in Fantastic Four: First Steps.

item.title: Immigrants sue over Trump's mandatory detention, no-bail policy
item.description: The Trump administration has stopped a longstanding practice of allowing immigrants who are challenging deportation to do so while free on bond. Officials now say they should all remain in detention.

item.title: Medical groups are concerned that RFK Jr. may dismiss a panel of primary care experts
item.description: The American Medical Association is urging Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. not to oust members of the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force, a group of experts focused on primary care.

item.title: US-EU TARIFF DEAL
item.description: The EU and the U.S. finally have a preliminary trade agreement. What do Europeans think of it? NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with EU ambassador to the United States Jovita NeliupÅ¡iene.
